New Records: Aaron Judge ended the longest home run drought of his career with a go-ahead grand slam in the seventh inning that rallied the New York Yankees to a 5-4 win over the Boston Red Sox
Key Match Events: The game was tied 4-4 in the seventh inning before the Yankees scored to win
Yoshida homered to right center (408 feet), Duran scored.
Story homered to right center (373 feet), Casas scored.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Yankee Stadium
The umpires were John Tumpane, Marvin Hudson, Hunter Wendelstedt, and Charlie Ramos.
